# readInBackgroundAndNotify()

**Instance Method**

Reads from the file or communications channel in the background and posts a notification when finished.

## Declaration

```swift
func readInBackgroundAndNotify()
```

## Discussion

This method performs an asynchronous [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/availableData] operation on a file or communications channel and posts an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/readCompletionNotification] notification on the current thread when that operation is complete. You must call this method from a thread that has an active run loop.

The length of the data is limited to the buffer size of the underlying operating system. The notification includes a `userInfo` dictionary that contains the data read; access this object using the `NSFileHandleNotificationDataItem` key.

Any object interested in receiving this data asynchronously must add itself as an observer of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/readCompletionNotification]. In communication via stream-type sockets, the receiver is often the object returned in the `userInfo` dictionary of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSNotification/Name-swift.struct/NSFileHandleConnectionAccepted].

Note that this method does not cause a continuous stream of notifications to be sent. If you wish to keep getting notified, you’ll also need to call [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/readInBackgroundAndNotify()] in your observer method.

- **waitForDataInBackgroundAndNotify()**: Asynchronously checks to see if data is available.
- **waitForDataInBackgroundAndNotify(forModes:)**: Asynchronously checks to see if data is available.
